info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 5:29PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coconino County through 600 PM MST... At 525 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Flagstaff. This storm was nearly stationary. Heavy downpours in excess of 1 inch and cloud-to-ground lightning are likely with this storm. Nothing but light showers over the fire scars for now but please stay tuned. HAZARD...Rain in excess of 1 inch, cloud-to-ground lightning, winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Flagstaff, Cosnino, Walnut Canyon National Monument, Flagstaff Mall, Downtown Flagstaff and Walnut Canyon Visitors Center. This includes the following highways... Route 66 between mile markers 196 and 204. Interstate 40 between mile markers 196 and 208. U.S. Highway 89 near mile marker 419. Highway 180 near mile marker 217. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
